title: MD
biography: The Institute of Molecular Biotechnology (IMBA) is a biomedical research organisation of the Austrian Academy of Sciences, founded in cooperation with the pharmaceutical company Boehringer Ingelheim. The institute employs around 250 people from over 40 countries, who perform basic research. IMBA is located at the Vienna BioCenter (VBC) and shares facilities and scientific training programs with the Gregor Mendel Institute of Molecular Plant Biology (GMI) of the Austrian Academy of Sciences and the Research Institute of Molecular Pathology (IMP), the basic research center of Boehringer Ingelheim.
aiSummary: Josef M. Penninger is a bone & immune biology specialist with an H-index of 155 at University of British Columbia (Faculty). Has been published in New England Journal of Medicine, JAMA Surgery, Annals of Surgery. Based in Canada.
